thread.title: UVU golf: Utah Valley sits in 14th after two rounds at Pat Lesser Harbottle Invite
thread.title_full: UVU golf: Utah Valley sits in 14th after two rounds at Pat Lesser Harbottle Invite

title: UVU golf: Utah Valley sits in 14th after two rounds at Pat Lesser Harbottle Invite
text:
Published: Monday, Oct. 12 2015 11:00 p.m. MDT Updated: 10 minutes ago Utah Valley freshman Pernille Echberg putts. She leads the Wolverines after two rounds of play at the Pat Lesser Harbottle Invitational with a two-round total of 156 (+12). Shane Truskolaski, UVU Athletics Enlarge photoÂ» Summary 
The Utah Valley University women's golf team turned in scores of 313 and 326 during the opening day of competition at Seattle University's Pat Lesser Harbottle Invitational on Monday to find itself in 14th place out of 16 teams with a total of 639. 
The Utah Valley University women's golf team turned in scores of 313 and 326 during the opening day of competition at Seattle University's Pat Lesser Harbottle Invitational on Monday to find itself in 14th place out of 16 teams with a two-round total of 639 (+63). 
The Wolverines, who sat in eighth place after the completion of Monday's opening round, were led by freshman Pernille Echberg 's 12-over-par 156 on day one. The true freshman from Ry, Denmark, carded scores of 77 and 79 en route to finding herself in a tie for 31st place on the leaderboard. Echberg recorded four birdies on Monday, picking up one in round one and three more in round two. 
Senior Kalea Heu is next for Utah Valley as she sits just one shot back of Echberg in a tie of 37th place with a 13-over-par 157. After carding UVU's best score of the day with a 2-over 74 in the morning, which included four birdies and a 3-under-par 34 on the back nine, Heu capped the day by tallying an 11-over 83 during the Monday's second round. 
Redshirt freshman Carly Dehlin , junior Kimberly Nyhus and senior Cassandra Lesa round out UVU's field of five at the tournament, as they sit in 60th, 61st and 70th places, respectively. Dehlin leads the group after carding a 162 (79-83), while Nyhus is next with a 165 (84-81) and Lesa rounds out the group with a 166 (83-83). 
Fellow redshirt freshman Ana Raga too is competing for the Wolverines as an individual at the Pat Lesser Harbottle Invite and enters Tuesday's final round tied for 79th with a two-round total of 168 (83-85). 
The Pac-12 Washington Huskies lead the tournament at 4-over par (580), while Idaho sits in second (604) and Cal State Fullerton and Cal Poly are tied for third (610). UW's Julianne Alvarez is also the event's individual leader at 1-under par (143). 
The Pat Lesser Harbottle Invitational, which is being contested at the Tacoma Country Club in Lakewood, concludes on Tuesday. The tournament's final round begins with a shotgun start at 8:30 a.m. PT. James Warnick is an assistant sports information director at Utah Valley University.   about   Recommended Stories
